# Masonry _Cascading grid layout library_ Masonry works by placing elements in optimal position based on available vertical space, sort of like a mason fitting stones in a wall. Youâ€™ve probably seen it in use all over the Internet. For complete docs and demos, see [masonry.desandro.com](http://masonry.desandro.com) or [masonryjs.com](http://masonryjs.com) if you're lazy, ## Install A packaged source file includes everything you need to use Masonry. + [masonry.pkgd.min.js](dist/masonry.pkgd.min.js) + [masonry.pkgd.js](dist/masonry.pkgd.js) ### Bower If you are cool with the command line, install Masonry as a [Bower](http://bower.io) package: ``` bash bower install masonry ``` ## Initialize ### In JavaScript ``` js var container = document.querySelector('#container'); var msnry = new Masonry( container, { // options... itemSelector: '.item', columnWidth: 200 }); ``` ### In HTML Add a class of `js-masonry` to your element.
